sentences.en: A 15-year lifespan is not uncommon for a dog.
sentences.cn: 15年的寿命对狗而言是比较常见的。

sentences.en: Both are blessed with uncommon ability to fix things.
sentences.cn: 两人在修理东西上都有一手绝活。

sentences.en: Cancer of the breast in young women is uncommon.
sentences.cn: 乳腺癌在年轻女子当中并不常见。

sentences.en: Even if the boy is of uncommon brilliance, he should not have been praised to the skies.
sentences.cn: 即使那男孩确实聪明过人, 也不该把他捧到天上去.

sentences.en: Experimentally, one form of such uncommon matter has been observed.
sentences.cn: 人们已经在实验中观察到了这类不寻常物质的一种形式.

sentences.en: His dilemma was not a uncommon one in modern China.
sentences.cn: 他的尴尬处境,在现代中国并不少见.

sentences.en: It is not uncommon to hear that a shipping company has made a claim for the cost of salvaging a sunken ship.
sentences.cn: 航运公司为打捞沉船的费用而提出要求,这并非奇闻.

sentences.en: On Friday he showed neither decency nor dignity. It was an uncommon lapse.
sentences.cn: 星期五那天他的表现既不得体，又有失尊严。如此失态非常少有。

sentences.en: She read Cecelia's last letter with uncommon interest.
sentences.cn: 她怀着极大的兴趣读完了塞塞莉娅的最后一封信。

sentences.en: Side effects from the drug are uncommon.
Such attitudes were not at all uncommon thirty years ago.
sentences.cn: 这些看法在30年前很常见.

sentences.en: The return of spring, and the revivification of nature, is a period hailed with uncommon delight.
sentences.cn: 春回大地, 万物复苏是令人异常喜悦的一段时光.

sentences.en: There was an uncommon likeness between the two boys.
sentences.cn: 这两个男孩长得像极了.

sentences.en: Violent crimes against the elderly are fortunately very uncommon.
sentences.cn: 幸好针对老年人的暴力犯罪非常罕见。

trans.tran_cn: 不寻常的，罕见的，非凡的，杰出的，非常接近的
